function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of evidence for the benefits of active transportation modes in relation to generalized biking and walking behaviors","Impact":"Inability to make informed decisions about promoting active transportation","Mitigation":"Conducting more comprehensive studies that encompass a wider range of biking and walking behaviors","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis tools for tracking biking and walking behaviors","People":"Policy makers, urban planners, and transportation authorities","Owner":"Researchers, government agencies, and transportation organizations"},{"Description":"Correlation between accessible shopping mall area and lower disease case rates in lower-income communities","Impact":"Unequal distribution of essential services leading to higher infection rates in certain communities","Mitigation":"Equitable urban planning to ensure equal access to essential services in all communities","Technologies":"Geospatial mapping tools, urban planning software, data analysis tools","People":"Urban planners, community leaders, and government agencies","Owner":"City planning departments, government agencies, and community organizations"},{"Description":"Direct link between spatial allocations of points of interest and infection rate","Impact":"Inadequate planning of essential services leading to higher infection rates in specific areas","Mitigation":"Incorporating the allocation of essential services into city development planning and zoning regulations","Technologies":"Geospatial mapping tools, urban planning software, data analysis tools","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, and community leaders","Owner":"City planning departments, public health agencies, and community organizations"}]}
